publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

msIdentifier.repository: Bibliothèque nationale de France, fonds Pelliot Koutchéen (Paris)

altIdentifier.idno: Pelliot Koutchéen Duldur Aqur M 507(37) et (36)
Pelliot Koutchéen Compatibilité de monastère 37 et 36 [PK Cp 37

seg.seg: [This] (is) the thing embezzled (lit. 'taken') by [Puttewante]. ///
/// (to us/them). • The enclosed field ... on the pretext of (payment/levy) to Akau, ... /// /// ... (that) he obtained, he should return to us.
But what has been imposed (in the form of) enclosed fields, we should obtain them (by a decree of release?). •
Therefore, in order to settle the village/rural area (of/and) the monastery, ... I will settle ... the Teṃttsäwe village/area ... , ...
All the estate (that) Puttewante has ... /// /// ... are to/of us.
Therefore, /// /// we will not leave ... either. • ///
/// ... of/to/by Puttewante ... ///
Koroy's finger-measure. (twenty) ///
He took three bolts of kaum* as (the equivalent of) maṅkusäko*. (But) he did not buy maṅkusäko*. Neither did he pay (the levy by) the bolts of kaum*.
Saṅkayśe*'s finger-measure. ///
Laraiyśe*'s finger-measure. ///
Citile*'s finger-measure. ///
... [finger-measure]. ... ///
In the 23rd year, in the 8th month. Puttewante said: "Akau asks for one thousand coins."
[Korośkile] /// /// were ... thousand (coins). (Puttewante) [imposed on] Koroke*. ///
... [Kercapiśke] ... from the Moko ... [to/of Puttewante] ///
/// ... Puttewante [took] eight hundred coins concerning the enclosed field (in the domain?) of Mokṣa* ... ///
[untranslatable]
In the 23rd regnal year, in the 6th month, Puttewante came to me.

He said: "Akau (asks for) ten bolts of kaum* for his attendance (?) in the army. We acquired (them) from Wantiśke. But I have not given to Akau. Now I am scared. He will chase the ten bolts of kaum* after me. The horse to be delivered to Tukṣi* at the post station Olākwāṃ, I (will) perfectly prepare for us/you".

(Thus) I took (or borrowed?) one thousand two hundred coins from Korośkile of Tār*, as (the equivalent of) thirty-two (piculs of) grains." (Although) Puttewante gave the above coins to Capeś, he did not well prepare the horse.
In the 24th regnal year, the Prefects of Samantatir were Akau (and) Meñiṃ.
... assigned ... to us/them: sixteen thousand. (These) were the coins [for (exempting our) service] (?).

In the 23rd regnal year, in the 4th month, Puttewante ordered us to buy a horse for giving (to the authorities) at the post station Olākwāṃ. We drove (by force) hither a horse (valued) at twenty bolts of kaum* from Wantiśke.
On that very day, Puttewante rode the horse down to a pond/spring, again he rode (it) back.There have been fourty (bolts). It was wounded. It died out.
Puttewante ... /// /// ... on this pretext/for this reason, there were fourty (bolts). ... ///
/// ... Koroy ... a letter to the Great Commissioner ... ///
... to give fresh (grains), (sb.) [received/gained] thirty (piculs of) grains. [He gave wheat for ...].
Puttewante carried one grey mare away from Cipaiśe. Its sister was (assigned?) to Cipaiśe. He (= Puttewante) carried this one away (as well).
At (the cost of) the fresh grains of the 19th year, Puttewante made tanti for us. Yet he did not make it ready. In that while, he was on the way to Coṅkśi*, (so he was absent.)
[Puttewante] asked for all (the coins) ..., (but) he did not pay the dues/debt. [In the monastery ...]
Now, (to substitute for the failed tanti), Cipaiśe cannot complain about paying (of) grain (but seek to solve the trouble).
Puttewante gave that mare at Olākwāṃ in (the manner of?) ṣreṃ* (?). Puttawarme gave him one thousand coins. He has collected both mares (?).
Because of the dues/debt (assigned to?) the saṃgha, Koroy's paternal field was imposed for Ṣoṅkse*.
On the pretext (about) Akau ... released(?) away...
He obtained three jars/vats of alcoholic beverage, (made of) tsäṅkana (?).
He obtained ... (coins) : fifteen thousand. ... dried(?)... ///
He sold ... for (the unit price of) ten (coins): five [hundreds?].
He obtained seeds of *eṅkara (?): chopped/husked(?), one picul.
In the 22nd regnal year, Puttewante embezzled Cinasene's own enclosed field, with the wheat produced (there).

Until now, it (i.e. the wheat?) is imposed (in Cinasene's name. There) is a jar/vat (and) a tsere of alcohol beverage (to be paid, and there) are six piculs of naked barley (to be paid). Akau is ... living ... he receives seeds of *eṅkara (?): ten piculs. The coins concerning Cinasene's enclosed field: six thousand.
(Sb.) paid the enclosed field of/to (sb.) (which was) due ... : [seven] ///
In order to (pay the tax on) the enclosed farm, a land is imposed : six [piculs]. • ... of this enclosed farm ... Werpiśke gave .... Now, [in total] ///
/// (sb.) gave to Suklyike ... • ... ///
... [Puttewante used the enclosed farm] deprived from Cinasene, [quite arrogantly].
... (sth./sb.) has been [watched]. He says: "Twenty (piculs?) of wheat belong to Lyau[t]tu* is to be immediately carried by me from the prefecture."
Puttewante deliberately(?) imposed on three brothers. •
He exempted the first (lit. 'one') brother nine bolts of kaum*. (This man, namely) Puttesene, (from) thirty-two bolts of kaum* (then) is working for Puttewante (as a deal).
He cannot fulfill the tax/corvée of the 4th year.
He (=Puttewante) deliberately(?) imposed on the second brother for Putteyāne: in (the amount of) twenty bolts of kaum*.
On the way to (the district) of Yśematka, Puttewante stole a donkey. ... of saṃgha (?) ... /// /// (sb.) gave ... •
All the ... of taxable (men/things) ... ///
/// ... up to ... (sth.) is imposed. ... The thing ... ///
He imposed ... in the saṃgha ...: in two thousand five hundred (coins). • ... seven ... bolts of kaum* fell to (sb.). twenty bolts of kaum*
Now, in two places, Puttewante imposed on him. Puttewante ... the bolts of kaum*. •
In this year, Puttewante embezzled Ṣtakkale's enclosed field.
He imposed on (him sth.) to Āṃśi(?): for (the equivalent of) three thousand five hundred (coins).
[For] three [years], he imposed on Ṣtakkale's son in peṣkeṃn for Usūkore*: two thousand and five hundred (coins).
He [imposed] on Kṣemiśke*: ... [thousand] (coins). ///
In this year, he [imposed] on Erkañciśke ///
... for ppau.* •
These seventy-six bolts of [kaum*] ///
[In (this) year], he [imposed on Sutane] ///
... coins. one thousand four hundred.
In (this) year, he sold Cinasene's daughter: ... ///
In (this) year, Yśematkaṣṣe (i.e. a man of Yśematka) gave to the saṃgha's five/ten bolts of kaum* to be brought. [Puttewante took (them)].
In (this) year, we obtained kaum* (produced?) in the estates (to be sent) to Teṅkiśke: eight bolts. Again, [Puttewante] took (them).
In (this) year, we obtained kaum* (produced?) in the estates at Paśārki*: five bolts. Puttewante took (them).
In the 23rd year, in the 10th month, Akau came to [the village/rural area] to accommodate (?) the Great Commissioner (on the way) to Ykāmeke*.
[Puttewante] made yośa* for him. A goat/sheep belong to the saṃgha ... ///
He gave alcoholic beverage ...: one picul, seven pecks. This alcoholic beverage ... [naked barley] .... He even took millet l. ...: seven piculs, five pecks.
We bought yakso* in Olākwāṃ: five pecks, at (a cost of) one picul and five pecks of millet l.. It is ālttsettstsa (?) to give/pay.

In the 22nd regnal year, Candrawarme ... /// /// ... in total, he (= Puttewante) asked the due coins: six thousand. "Has Puttewante paid all? He has [not] paid the [debt/dues]." They (now) ask from Ś[w]esan*(?).
Puttewante gave naked barley to Akau for a yośa*: one peck. He even took five pecks of millet l. belonging to the saṃgha.
And this Puttewante ... from Akau ... let go the saṃgha's (property?) as the matter of tom pari (?).
In total, the excessive levy that has been taken/embezzled by Puttewante: ...
Bolts of kaum*: one hundred and ninty-eight ... (Given the price per bolt as three hundred coins, the equivalent amount of coins was: fifty-nine thousand) for hundred. •
Coins were: ... ///

Grain is: six hundred eighty-one piculs, five pecks. (Given) the price (per peck as) [five] (coins, the equivalent amount of) coins was: thirty-four thousand and seventy-five. (i.e. 5 x 6815 = 34075).

Alcoholic beverage was: five jars/vats (and) a tsere. He sold one thousand five hundred (coins per jar/vat). In total, the (equivalent amount of) coins was: eight thousands two hundred and fifty. (5.5 x 1500 = 8250)
[To sum up], the bolts of kaum*, the coins, the grain, the alcoholic beverage, ...: one hundred eleven [thousand] ... ///
In the 23rd regnal year, in the 4th month. He (= Puttewante) asked for ten bolts of kaum* for Akau's attendance (?) in an army.
To Kuleṅkar-Akau, the Vice Commissioner and Great General: The kapyāres of Samantatir, led by Suklyike, address (to you) very deferentially.
Oh lord! The (things that) Puttewante has done lawlessly [to us], or the things that have been taken (by him), they have been written above. • The account is (given) above.
(Previously) [I have given] this indictment (lit. 'thing, affair'). If the Minister had made/done (something), there would have been much progress (of it).
Similar to us, a servant/slave nearby ... He mistreated ... more badly than dogs.
Now, ... he made our parts ... : at Arnassi*, in five karpoñña* (?). He [has dispatched] twenty-eight men, together with a woman and a boy. •
He said: " ... I do (sth.) ... for the monastery. ... ///
He said: "Akau asks for (it)." We borrowed (the ten bolts) from Wantiśke with interest (?). He (= Puttewante) did not give to Akau. For this reason, there have been twenty (bolts that we owe).
At (the cost/value of) sixteen (?) thousand (coins), (delivered) to hand ... ///
Thus the tax/levy will fall (to us). ... ///
/// He [imposed] ... seven persons ... ///
... the field cannot be cultivated by us/them neither. • He controlled himself the goat/sheep (in) pasture/pen (?). ///
And this litigation ... [the] ... many things. It has been taken (by Puttewante). We, in whatever circumstance, ... this [debt] ... , rather than prepare the tax/levy. •
Now, we all together have come here. Therefore this is our request: the things that Puttewante has taken/embezzled ... he compensates (?) our ... .
What Akau should have obtained, [we will ... ] ... that. • What Akau (should not obtain) ... ///
[He imposed] deliberately(?) on two brothers ... ///

p.note: Consisting of an alignment of nine paper sheets of 39,4 cm (lines 1–14), 39,8 cm (lines 15–28), 39,5 cm (lines 29–42), 39,3 cm (lines 43–55), 39,9 cm (lines 56–67), 39 cm (lines 68–78), 37,1 cm (lines 79–90), 39,2 cm (lines 91–102), and 33,3 cm height (lines 103–113). The upper 5 sheets (55 lines) belong to "PK DA M 507.37", the lower 4 sheets (58 lines) to "PK DA M 507.36".
, kätstsa: sic, i.e. Fremdzeichen ka plus dots of Fremdvokal ä above.
ppaumś\: sic, i.e. non-Fremdzeichen in virāma position.
kaumś^ä\: sic, i.e. non-Fremdzeichen in virāma position.

'taken') by [Puttewante]. /// a2 In the 24th regnal year, the Prefects of Samantatir were Akau (and) Meñiṃ. a2-3 ... assigned ... to us/them: sixteen thousand. (These) were the coins [for (exempting our) service] (?). a3-4 [Puttewante] asked for all (the coins) ..., (but) he did not pay the dues/debt. [In the monastery ...] a4-5 (Sb.) paid the enclosed field of/to (sb.) (which was) due ... : [seven] /// a6 These seventy-six bolts of [kaum*] /// a7-8 In the 22nd regnal year, Candrawarme ... /// /// ... in total, he (= Puttewante) asked the due coins: six thousand. "Has Puttewante paid all? He has [not] paid the [debt/dues]." They (now) ask from Ś[w]esan*(?). a8-9 In the 23rd regnal year, in the 4th month. He (= Puttewante) asked for ten bolts of kaum* for Akau's attendance (?) in an army. a9-11 He said: "Akau asks for (it)." We borrowed (the ten bolts) from Wantiśke with interest (?). He (= Puttewante) did not give to Akau. For this reason, there have been twenty (bolts that we owe). a11-12 He took three bolts of kaum* as (the equivalent of) maṅkusäko*. (But) he did not buy maṅkusäko*. Neither did he pay (the levy by) the bolts of kaum*. a12-13 In the 23rd year, in the 8th month. [to/of Puttewante] /// a15-16 /// ... Puttewante [took] eight hundred coins concerning the enclosed field (in the domain?) of Mokṣa* ... /// a16-17 [untranslatable] a17 In the 23rd regnal year, in the 6th month, Puttewante came to me. a17-19 He said: "Akau (asks for) ten bolts of kaum* for his attendance (?) in the army. We acquired (them) from Wantiśke. But I have not given to Akau. Now I am scared. He will chase the ten bolts of kaum* after me. It was wounded. It died out. a24-25 Puttewante ... /// /// ... on this pretext/for this reason, there were fourty (bolts). ... /// a25-26 /// ... Koroy ... a letter to the Great Commissioner ... /// a27 ... to give fresh (grains), (sb.) [received/gained] thirty (piculs of) grains. (coins) : fifteen thousand. ... dried(?)... /// a36 He sold ... for (the unit price of) ten (coins): five [hundreds?]. a36-37 He obtained seeds of *eṅkara (?): chopped/husked(?), one picul. a37-38 In the 22nd regnal year, Puttewante embezzled Cinasene's own enclosed field, with the wheat produced (there). a38-40 Until now, it (i.e. the wheat?) is imposed (in Cinasene's name. There) is a jar/vat (and) a tsere of alcohol beverage (to be paid, and there) are six piculs of naked barley (to be paid). Akau is ... living ... he receives seeds of *eṅkara (?): ten piculs. The coins concerning Cinasene's enclosed field: six thousand. a40-42 In order to (pay the tax on) the enclosed farm, a land is imposed : six [piculs]. • ... of this enclosed farm ... Werpiśke gave .... Now, [in total] /// a42-43 /// (sb.) gave to Suklyike ... • ... /// a44 ... [Puttewante used the enclosed farm] deprived from Cinasene, [quite arrogantly]. a45-46 ... (sth./sb.) has been [watched]. 'one') brother nine bolts of kaum*. (sth.) is imposed. ... [thousand] (coins). /// a59 In this year, he [imposed] on Erkañciśke /// a59-60 ... for ppau.* • a60 [In (this) year], he [imposed on Sutane] /// a60-61 ... coins. one thousand four hundred. a61 In (this) year, he sold Cinasene's daughter: ... /// a62-63 In (this) year, Yśematkaṣṣe (i.e. a man of Yśematka) gave to the saṃgha's five/ten bolts of kaum* to be brought. [Puttewante took (them)]. a63-64 In (this) year, we obtained kaum* (produced?) in the estates (to be sent) to Teṅkiśke: eight bolts. Again, [Puttewante] took (them). a64-65 In (this) year, we obtained kaum* (produced?) in the estates at Paśārki*: five bolts. Puttewante took (them). a65-66 In the 23rd year, in the 10th month, Akau came to [the village/rural area] to accommodate (?) the Great Commissioner (on the way) to Ykāmeke*. a66-67 [Puttewante] made yośa* for him. A goat/sheep belong to the saṃgha ... /// a67-68 He gave alcoholic beverage ...: one picul, seven pecks. This alcoholic beverage ... [naked barley] .... He even took millet l. ...: seven piculs, five pecks. a69-70 We bought yakso* in Olākwāṃ: five pecks, at (a cost of) one picul and five pecks of millet l.. It is ālttsettstsa (?) to give/pay. a70-71 Puttewante gave naked barley to Akau for a yośa*: one peck. He even took five pecks of millet l. belonging to the saṃgha. a71-72 And this Puttewante ... from Akau ... let go the saṃgha's (property?) as the matter of tom pari (?). a73 In total, the excessive levy that has been taken/embezzled by Puttewante: ... a74-75 Bolts of kaum*: one hundred and ninty-eight ... (Given the price per bolt as three hundred coins, the equivalent amount of coins was: fifty-nine thousand) for hundred. • a75 Coins were: ... /// a76-77 Grain is: six hundred eighty-one piculs, five pecks. (Given) the price (per peck as) [five] (coins, the equivalent amount of) coins was: thirty-four thousand and seventy-five. (i.e. 5 x 6815 = 34075). a78-79 Alcoholic beverage was: five jars/vats (and) a tsere. He sold one thousand five hundred (coins per jar/vat). In total, the (equivalent amount of) coins was: eight thousands two hundred and fifty. (5.5 x 1500 = 8250) a79-81 [To sum up], the bolts of kaum*, the coins, the grain, the alcoholic beverage, ...: one hundred eleven [thousand] ... /// a82-83 To Kuleṅkar-Akau, the Vice Commissioner and Great General: The kapyāres of Samantatir, led by Suklyike, address (to you) very deferentially. a83-85 Oh lord! The (things that) Puttewante has done lawlessly [to us], or the things that have been taken (by him), they have been written above. • The account is (given) above. a85-86 (Previously) [I have given] this indictment (lit. 'thing, affair'). If the Minister had made/done (something), there would have been much progress (of it). a86-87 Similar to us, a servant/slave nearby ... He mistreated ... more badly than dogs. a87-89 Now, ... he made our parts ... : at Arnassi*, in five karpoñña* (?). He [has dispatched] twenty-eight men, together with a woman and a boy. • a89-90 He said: " ... I do (sth.) ... for the monastery. ... /// a90-91 At (the cost/value of) sixteen (?) thousand (coins), (delivered) to hand ... /// a92 Thus the tax/levy will fall (to us). ... /// a92-93 /// He [imposed] ... seven persons ... /// a94 ... the field cannot be cultivated by us/them neither. • He controlled himself the goat/sheep (in) pasture/pen (?). /// a94-96 And this litigation ... [the] ... many things. It has been taken (by Puttewante). We, in whatever circumstance, ... this [debt] ... , rather than prepare the tax/levy. • a96-98 Now, we all together have come here. (that) he obtained, he should return to us. a102-103 But what has been imposed (in the form of) enclosed fields, we should obtain them (by a decree of release?). • a103-105 Therefore, in order to settle the village/rural area (of/and) the monastery, ... (twenty) /// a110 Saṅkayśe*'s finger-measure. /// a111 Laraiyśe*'s finger-measure. /// a112 Citile*'s finger-measure. /// a113 ... [finger-measure]. ... ///

a1 s(e puttewattentse|p)u(tewa)t(t)entse kakāmau wäntare a2 ikäṃ śtwer|śwer kṣuṃntsa samantatirṣi ypoy mokonta takāre akau meñiṃ ke ·e /// a3 tesa tmāne|tumane ṣkas yaltse|yiltse cāñi yarpoś ṣeyeṃnme po puttewatte|putewa(tte) /// a4 preksa peri mā wasa saṅ(k)rā(mn)e /// a5 ntse werwiye par«r»a wasa ṣu(kt) /// a6 toyna ṣuktaṅka ṣkas kau(mma) /// a7 ikäṃ wi kṣuṃntsa candrawarme (– – – – – –) (·) k(eś ne) cān(eṃ) p(e)r(i) pr(e)ksa ṣkas yaltse|y(i)|ltse a8 po puttewatte|putewatte mante wasa (pe)ri mā wasa wesanmeṃ preksa ikäṃ trai kṣuṃntsa|kṣuṃ|ntsa a9 śtarce meñne|meṃne akaumtse retkene yasiś śak kaumma|kauma preksa te weña akau prekṣäṃ|pre|kṣäṃ a10 wantiśkenmeṃ tsmoñesa kamāmtte akaumtsa mā wasa toy ṣewisa ikäṃ|i|käṃ a11 takāre tarya kaumma|kauma maṅkusäkaisa kamāte maṅkusäkai mā käryāte a12 kaumma|kauma māṣ wasa ikäṃ trai kṣuṃntsa oktañce meñne|meṃne puttewatte|putewatte weña akau a13 yaltse cāneṃ prekṣäṃ koro(śk)i(l)e /// /// ·i – yaltse|(y)il(ts)e a14 takāre korakeṃ eñcil te(ssa) /// kercapiśke|(ke)|rcapiśke a15 mokonmeṃ puttewattentse|putewa(ntentse) /// werwyeṣeṃ|(we)|rwyeṣeṃ a16 puttewatte|putewatte o mokṣaiññe kante|käṃnte cāne(ṃ) kam(ā)t(e) ś· (– – – – – – –) tu m(ā) eṅksate|e(ṅksa)|te a17 ikäṃ trai kṣuṃntsa ṣkaśce meñne|meṃne puttewatte|putewatte śema-ñ te weña akau retkne yasiś a18 śak kaumma|kauma wantiśkenmeṃ kamāmtte akaumtse mā wsāwa ñaka pärskau nesau śak kaumma|kauma a19 skāyañ olākwāṃne tukṣiś yalye yakwe ñiś solme maskaume tārñe korośkilenmeṃ|korośki|lenmeṃ a20 täryāka wi śātresa yaltse|yiltse wi kante|käṃnte cāneṃ kāmmai|kāmai puttewatte|putewatte capeśintse mante|ma|nte a21 wasa yakwe solme mā maṣa ikäṃ trai kṣuṃntsa śtarce meñne|meṃne puttewatte|putewatte olākwāṃne|olākw(ā)ṃ|ne a22 aisi yakwe kärnāsi yātka-me wantiśkenmeṃ ikäṃ kaumasa yakwe   • Generally, I entered Pinault's transcription/transliteration. But some original (and editorial?) corrections may not be noted (correctly). [[Pinault typoscript]] and [[Ching 2010]] differ in quite a lot of details in their transcription/transliteration. Alas, it's a mess. The original has to be checked, again. –Martin (Mon, 2014-12-15, 00:13:07)

Consisting of an alignment of nine paper sheets of 39,4 cm (lines 1–14), 39,8 cm (lines 15–28), 39,5 cm (lines 29–42), 39,3 cm (lines 43–55), 39,9 cm (lines 56–67), 39 cm (lines 68–78), 37,1 cm (lines 79–90), 39,2 cm (lines 91–102), and 33,3 cm height (lines 103–113). The upper 5 sheets (55 lines) belong to "PK DA M 507.37", the lower 4 sheets (58 lines) to "PK DA M 507.36".
Pelliot Koutchéen Duldur Aqur M 507(37) et (36), Pelliot Koutchéen Compatibilité de monastère 37 et 36 [PK Cp 37, PK Cp 36]

a20–21. [man]te or [mak]te.

a36., a58. kätstsa: sic, i.e. Fremdzeichen ka plus dots of Fremdvokal ä above.

a60. ppaumś\: sic, i.e. non-Fremdzeichen in virāma position.

a82. kaumś^ä\: sic, i.e. non-Fremdzeichen in virāma position.

laṃṣalle keṃ mā_ṣ\ nesaṃnme • pāske śānta m(a)[k]c[e] [w]lawāte • śalle_ś\ t[ā_u] a95 māka wäntare • kakāmau ste we_s\ [i]ñcau wäntaresa ceṃ [y]e[ki ·st·] – a96 [c]esa wa_t\ pauśye yame_m\ • ñake po ysomosa [ś]ka maita_m\ ta[k]a a97 ne sā_u plāce star-me ce puttewatte wäntare kakāmau ste m· – – a98 eru_p\ ra_m_a_ṣ_ṣ_aṃn-me cau akau _k_alpau tākaṃ [c]au [p]otarne – – – a99 namtta_r\ • cau akau «†–» mā [_k_al](pau tākaṃ) /// a100 rriwentasa wi procera e(ñ)[c]i(_l\ tessa) /// a101 me • ce akaumne ṣewisa werwy(e) [e]·s· /// a102 kalpa cau _p_as_tä\ aime • ce no werwyenta eṅku ste toyna we_s\ – a103 rra aittsi _k_allā_m(\) • o_t\ saṅkrā_m\ kwaṣṣai lamatt(s)i /// a104 teṃ«†w»[t]tsäwe k_uṣaintse lamau atamai [m]o[k]e se ·e /// a105 ṣṣai po puttewatte keta _p_as_tä\ [m·] /// a106 prāyä\ star-me taiseṃ /// a107 parra mā_ṣ\ yne_m\ • /// a108 pi puttewattentse [t·] /// a109 koroyntse kapc[i] y[s]· /// a110 saṅkayśi kapci /// a111 laraiyśintse kapci /// a112 citilentse kapci [ku] /// a113 – [k]eṃś(·)e (ka)[p](c)i – – ///
Bibliothèque nationale de France, fonds Pelliot Koutchéen (Paris)

div.p:
Alternative classifications:

  • Generally, I entered Pinault's transcription/transliteration. But some original (and editorial?) corrections may not be noted (correctly). </bibl> and <bibl><title corresp="ref:ching2010"/></bibl> differ in quite a lot of details in their transcription/transliteration. Alas, it's a mess. The original has to be checked, again. –Martin (Mon, 2014-12-15, 00:13:07)</li></ul></p></project_comment>
